page.title: 17Siren, Martock fire station
page.content: A few months ago Martock Fire Station's siren was taken out of use leaving people living near the fire station in Manor Road unaware of rushing cars and fire engines. The change was made when each fireman was issued with a personal alarm bleeper, but a new siren is now in use, as a result of local pressure. Nearly all the fire stations lost their sirens; Martock, however, decided to fight for theirs. Before the siren was reintroduced, workers from Burfield's glove factory had to get out of the way very quickly because they didn't know when cars would rush down Manor Road carrying firemen.
